data.title: R. Duane Carter

data.text:
BIOG: NAME: UPD: 19970502 -TEXT-

CARTER R. Duane, age 62, died Thursday, May 1, 1997, at Baptist Integris Hospital. He was born September 10, 1934, the only child of James Alvis Carter & Frances (Teakell) Carter, in Chickasha, Ok. He was preceded in death by his father, grandmother Jewel Teakell & grandfather John Teakell. He is survived by his wife of 43 years, Villa Rae, of the home; his mother, Frances Carter of Chickasha, Ok; and a host of friends. Duane attended the University of Oklahoma where he received his BA in Accounting in 1956. He received his commission in the ROTC, and served 2 years in the US Army and 11 years in the Reserves, retiring with the rank of Captain. He received his LLB from the University of Oklahoma in 1960. He worked as a certified public accountant and tax lawyer all of his professional career. He was senior partner at Grant Thornton at the time of his death. An active member of the Oklahoma Bar Association, Oklahoma Society of Certified Public Accountants, and had been a partner of the Bohanon, Barth & Carter Law Firm. Duane was active in several volunteer organizations. He was the first treasurer of the Oklahoma Arts Institute, and chairman of its Finance Committee for 20 years. He served as treasurer of the Foundation for Excellence annual banquet, and was the treasurer for the City of Nichols Hills. He was active in the Oklahoma Public Schools Foundation, and served as its chairman for 2 years, and was a member of the Oklahoma City Golf & Country Club. Memorial service will be 2:00 p.m. Saturday, May 3, 1997, Hahn-Cook/Street & Draper Chapel, with private interment at Rose Hill Burial Park. In lieu of flowers, memorials may be made to Oklahoma Medical Research Foundation, Non Hodgkins Lymphoma Fund; the Oklahoma Arts Institute, 720 N.W. 50th, Oklahoma City, Ok 73118; or the Oklahoma City Public Schools Foundation, 525 N.W. 13th, Oklahoma City, Ok 73103.
